description: Integers whose set of prime factors (taken with multiplicity) uses each digit exactly once (i.e. is pandigital) in base 10.
example: 15618090 is in the sequence since 2 x 3 x 5 x 487 x 1069 is pandigital; 29447898 because 2 x 3 x 107 x 45869 is pandigital.
author: Mike Keith (domnei(AT)aol.com) and _G. L. Honaker, Jr._, Jan 08 2001
